column4: not sure if this will help, but in the old days I used Mandrake (Mandriva) and needed eagle usb stuff. is that installed?
yes, it is but some guides say that it has to be removed cause it conflicts with the firmware i have to install
so i think i might try that
it's the USB version then I assumd?
assume
yes, unfortunately
!info eagle-usb-utils
the lights are on but no synchronization
does the modems status light blink when you start the computer and then gets stable after a while?
it gets on a couple of times but then both go out
the modem works well under windows
have you seen this? https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UsbAdslModem/ueagle-atm
yes, followed it except the step with the module removal which it says isn't necessary on 7.04
then I don't have much else to add... If I remeber correctly, the lights go out if the firmware hasn't been loaded.
yes it's a strange situation. i think i'll play with the module, there's nothing else to do. But thanks a whole lot for your time and interest :)
I remember that eagle modem with horror. least I could do. ;)
almost worth the investment to get  a "normal" modem with ethernet connection
yes, i think that would be a better solution. will do as soon as i have the cash to get rid of the usb modm!
hang on. which version is it? E4 or something else?
it's the e4, which tends to work only by chance as i have understood from the various guides
it's in french. altough not difficult level: http://www.siteduzero.com/tuto-3-16791-1-installer-un-sagem-f-st-800-e4-sous-ubuntu-edgy-eft-6-10-ou-feisty-fawn-7-04.html
might be worth a shot
thanks! :) missed that, will give it a try
